resources.string: There has been an error, OOPS!
Make sure you are in private for the this stage. Press "start" to continue and "hide" if you are disturbed
Now you must commit your passphrase to memory.
Your passphrase is used to activate your private Key, which is kept securely on this device
When you are happy that you can remember your passphrase, press "next"
Now see if you can remember your passphrase - enter it below.
Create your KeyLock from an existing PGP Key pair
Create your new KeyLock from scratch
This will create a KeyLock by generating a new OpenPGP key pair on this device. It may take a minute or so.
Please ensure that the PGP Private Key is already stored in a file on this device\'s filesystem and that you know its passphrase
Maybe you need to mount an SD card in your device?
Successfully read key file for PGP Private Key with ID:
Is the file you chose an Ascii-armored text file containing a supported PGP Private Key?
Before you can use KeyLocks, you need to set up your own KeyLock. This should take about five or ten undisturbed minutes.
KeyLocks is based on OpenPGP. If you already have an OpenPGP key, you can import it to KeyLocks; alternatively, KeyLocks will create one for you.
Pick a random-word passphrase from the generated list below.
Move the slider for a new list of longer or shorter passphrases.
No need to write it down: in the next step, KeyLocks will help you to commit it to memory.
Enter your passphrase again to apply it to your new KeyLock
This KeyLock is associated with the following identities:
KeyLocks hasn\'t finished generating your new KeyLock. Keep on practising your new passphrase while you wait!
